dict.acceptation: 一瞥；闪微光；掠过，擦过；随便提到，简略地触及；

sent.orig: She shot an angry glance at him/shot him an angry glance.
Pitty drew up her stout little body and gave the doctor glance for glance.
sent.trans: 皮蒂挺了挺她那胖胖的小个儿，向大夫妻一眼。

sent.orig: But I could easily detect an occasional wishful glance toward the bunch of plantains.
sent.trans: 如果我稍稍动一下，它就像闪电一样逃走，过一会再来打探。

sent.orig: Jim stole a glance at Mary to see if she approved of what he was suggesting.
sent.trans: 吉姆偷看了一眼玛丽看她否同意他的建议。

sent.orig: Of be clear at a glance is very conspicuous finance office entrance door.
sent.trans: 一目了然的便是十分显眼的财政厅大门。
